introduction: Virtual reality - also known as VR - allows you to put on a headset and escape into a completely dif

vocabulary.definition: of extreme force, degree, or strength
vocabulary.example: The VR experience was so intense that it felt like I was really there.

vocabulary.definition: an extreme or irrational fear of or aversion to something
vocabulary.example: She suffers from arachnophobia, a common phobia of spiders.

vocabulary.definition: relating to the healing of disease or injury
vocabulary.example: The VR therapy proved to be highly therapeutic for patients with anxiety disorders.

vocabulary.definition: the representation or expression of something in a tangible or visible form
vocabulary.example: Through VR, the prisoners experienced the embodiment of their victims' perspective.

vocabulary.definition: to restore to a position or condition of being integrated or united
vocabulary.example: The program focuses on reintegrating ex-convicts back into society after their release.

vocabulary.definition: a summary of what has been said or done
vocabulary.example: Before we end the meeting, let's do a quick recap of the main points discussed.
